comments.text:
OK, Ymir had the highest damage in the game, he still HAS one of the 
highest. The only higher damage ultimates I can see are Isis (1120 + 50% 
MP) and Janus (1200 + 50% MP), and both of those require some sort of 
secondary effect to boost their damage; Janus: range, 800 units, Isis: 
damage inside radius, 3.5x charges. Also, their ults do not scale with MP 
as much, 50% for Janus and Isis, and 150% for Ymir.

deathbringer on top of his passive made ymir wreck people's faces with 
basics.

Those were fun times.

captions.text:
what's going on everybody welcome to
episode two of Know Your Enemy
my name is Trendkill
let's get it on
so in case this the first episode of Know Your Enemy that you've watched if you want to

check out the Neith guide I go into extreme
detail as to what this series is going
to be about
also before you watch this guide make sure you have a basic understanding of MOBA knowledge

otherwise go check out my beginner's
guides those are gonna get you caught up in some

of the terminology and things that I may
use in this series

and so we don't waste too much of your
time let's go ahead and jump right into

the guide today we're gonna be talking
about the Ymir
The Father of the Frost Giants

all right now the first thing we do in
these videos

is we take a quick glance at what
the gods are good at you can see
Ymir's damage

is low but his defense is high, that is
because he is a guardian, he is supposed to
have high defense

he's not there to deal a ton of damage.
Now his mobility is extremely low

because he doesn't have any dashes, or
teleports, or jumps or anything like that

and his healing is zero is completely off
the grid

because he can't heal himself or his
team. You can see his utilities kinda
hovering around
average but his control is off the charts

that is because he has a wall that can
block your path,

he has 2 slows and he has a stun that
stuns you for longer than 2 seconds

he is by far and large the perfect
definition

of a Guardian. High control and high
defense that's exactly what you want
in that role
Alright, so let's take a more in-depth look at his kit and talk about some things
that you may have missed by briefly glancing through his abilities

first off let's talk about Ymir's
passive called Frostbite

this is what gives him the little bit
and utility that he had on that graph

what Frostbite does is when Ymir hits
you with one of its damaging abilities

those abilities apply to debug called
Frostbite.

For the next few seconds all of Ymir's
auto attacks that hit you will deal

double damage. Now this passive alone
allows him to play
outside of the Guardian role and actually have some success

so what you may see is in a Ymir coming
out of the jungle, freezing you
and just smacking you with his Ice Mallet

and actually dealing a considerable amount
damage. So understand that in casual

games you may see Ymir in the jungle
or in the solo lane

and you may see him start to run around
the map can really create some chaos for
the enemy team

another thing that we have to be
cognizant of is the amount of crowd
control Ymir has on

all of his abilities. He's got a
six-second

wall that blocks your path, a four second
slow on his Glacial Strike, a 2.5 second
stun on his Frost Breath,

and another three second slow inside
the large AOE

of his ultimate. This totals an insane
amount

of fifteen seconds worth a possible
crowd control.
Now if he breaks that up and uses his different crowd controlling abilities on

different people he can single-handedly
changed the tide of a battle

with the sheer amount of chaos he can
create.

So in the right hands Ymir can be a bad
mother-

And let's move on to the
reason you guys came here to watch the
video the mechanics section

for those who are new to the series this
is where we're gonna show you things
you need to watch out for if you're playing against an Ymir

don't forget if you are the one playing
as Ymir you can reverse this

information and use it to your advantage.
So for starters let's talk about his

Ice Wall, this ability is not to be
underestimated.

Yes it does no damage, but it can greatly
control a battle if used properly.
So for my first tip if you're playing a god that does not have ground targeted leap
meaning they can jump

through walls, be extremely careful of
running from an Ymir in the jungle.

Now in the lane the wall can also
be extremely tricky to deal with; however,

you have plenty of room to run around the
wall. In the jungle, that wall will
completely

block off a path and you're likely to
find yourself in a dead-end

getting killed. Now another thing about the
wall, and  this is more of a tip for if

you're playing Ymir, but you also
see an
enemy Ymir doing this, if you want to get away and you want to be able
to separate yourself with your ice wall

you can look straight down at the ground
cast, your Ice Wall

at your feet and before it spawns you
will have walked past it and cut
everybody else

off. Now you can only do this if you have
at least

rank two of whatever type of boots or
shoes you plan on buying.

The interesting thing about this ability
is that the more latency you have the
easier this trick is to pull off

so what I mean by that is if you go into
the jungle practice area and you try to
use your wall with rank two in Boots,

you will literally get stuck in it every
single time. But if you go into an

actual game there is latency
involve connecting to the server and
that latency is usually

just enough to allow you to sneak past
your wall

one of the very few instances where
latency actually helps you.

Alright so moving on we're gonna skip over
Glacial Strike, his second ability for
just a second

I first wanna talk about his third
ability Frost Breath, now this is arguably

one of the best CC abilities in the game
for two reasons:
one, it's extremely easy to hit and two, it last for 2.25 seconds
which is an insane amount of time in a fast-paced game like SMITE.

Now the reason I wanted to talk about
Frost Breath before Glacial Strike is
that my Glacial Strike tip

actually includes Frost Breath in it.
Basically if you can catch somebody with
your Frost Breath

and freeze them in place you are
guaranteed

to hit Glacial Strike. This is a
deadly combo. At max rank in
both abilities, Frost Breath will freeze them for 2.25 seconds and Glacial Strike will then slow them for

four seconds on top of that if you
time it probably.

That is six and a quarter seconds of some
sort CC.
Assuming he doesn't then catch you with his wall and then catch with his ultimate as
well

Ymir has the capability to combine
together upwards of

10 seconds worth of crowd control which
makes his kit

one of the most controlling kits in the
game. So while that's not a tip for just Glacial
Strike remember that that is an
integral part of him controlling the enemy. So if I were playing against

an Ymir I would definitely think about
having sprint and/or purification beads

to cleanse all the slows and the stuns
and he's gonna be throwing my way

now let's move back to Frost Breath, this is
not a tip about the ability itself it's
about an

item that gives Ymir more opportunities
to use

Frost Breath. Always be watching for the
enemy Ymir to have an active

item called blink. This item allows him
to teleport to you and after that he's

likely to catch you with the Frost
Breath.

Again after that becomes the ability
chain that may eventually lead to your
demise

so understand that you are never safe
around in an Ymir
with Blink. Now the last tip about Frost Breath, if you happen to be fighting in an Ymir and you
think he's going to freeze you soon
do not run away from him run around him.

Stay at his sides and his back because
Frost Breath

is a cone in front of him. If you
happen to sneak past his side while he's
getting ready to freeze you

you may miss the freeze and be able to
leave him completely vulnerable

now this is something you have to train
yourself to remember because it's not
natural for you wanna run towards danger

just remember that the further you get
away from Ymir the wider his reticule
gets because it is a cone shape

so the easier it is for him to hit you.
Now last but not least let's talk about his
ultimate Shards of Ice
There's really not much to be said about this ability. First off

remember that can cancel this early for
reduced damage
So you are never safe in his Ultimate. Make sure you dashboard or jump out or do whatever you
can to get out of it
so you don't take an insane amount of damage; however,
if you find yourself caught right in the middle of that ultimate and you know there's a 0 percent chance of
you getting out
instead of just running towards the edge of it, turn around and fight him.

You may deal enough damage to kill him
or may do enough damage that you're
gonna die

anyway, but maybe somebody else
on your team can pick up that kill.
Again it's a brain training thing, you see this humongous high damage

AOE starting to happen and your instinct is
to just run.

But if you can't get away anyway you
might as well do as much damage as you
can

and last but not least, a blanket tip for all
of Ymir's abilities

make sure you save your dashes, your
jumps, your teleports,

your Blink, and Sprint, make sure you save
everything you can

to get away from Ymir. Do not waste
your escape abilities on initiating

a fight with an Ymir unless you know for
a fact that his

CC abilities are on cooldown, otherwise
you run an extremely high risk of
getting combo'd to death
So there you have it guys, now hopefully you know how to react when you see an Ymir

chillin' in lane. Now if you see an Ymir you
won't freeze up.
No... Cold, ice, frosty...
There's a #@$!& joke here somewhere... anyway, again my name is Trendkill, make sure you
come check out the series next week when we're gonna be talking about Ra
the Egyptian Sun God
